content: bun hat bottom up neckflap hat knit in bulky weight yarn this hat eliminates those pesky drafts that work their way in between your hat and the collar of your coat the neckflap is worked back and forth then stitches are cast on for the front and the knitting is joined and worked in the round this pattern has been test knit check the pattern pages on ravelry com for notes on more bun hats © old trout designs 2013 rev 11_2013 pattern design clairvoyance graphics bun hat knitting directions neckflap materials using circular needle cast on 32/36 stitches yarn this hat can be made r 1 rs sl1 kfb k to last 2 with 80-100 yards of bulky stitches kfb p1 weight yarn or a combination r 2 sl1 k to last stitch p1 of yarns stranded together that r 3 sl1 kfb k to last 2 stitches will give the gauge below yarn kfb p1 36/40 sts suggestions lamb s pride continue in garter stitch slipping bulky brown sheep nature spun first stitch purling last until you chunky cascade 220 double- have about 2 inches from the stranded or other light worsted cast on edge ending with knit with wisdom yarns poems double-stranded chunky a wrong side row needles us #10 6 mm 16 circular needle and dpns or size on the next three row repeat the increasing sequence r 1 - 3 to give gauge below above 40/44 sts then knit 1 row it should be a wrong side row and cast on i use the backward loop method 24/29 sts turn your gauge work and knit all the way around join by slipping the last stitch onto 3 5 spi if you knit at 4 spi the the left needle and knitting 2 stitches first and last together place second number makes an 18 marker you should have 63/72 stitches on the needle hat brim purl around and then continue in garter stitch k 1 round p 1 round finished size until your brim is about an inch from your cast on front stitches the first number is for an 18 hat second for a 20 hat body work in stockinette stitch k every round for 3 5 - 4 more or about notes 4 5 - 5 from beginning of front brim and begin decreases i like to slip the first stitch and purl the last stitch when doing decreases switch from cirular needle to dpns as needed garter stitch r 1 k7 k2tog 7 section decrease/8 section decrease the backward loop cast on may r 2 and all even number row through r 12 knit all stitches initially seem loose but will look r 3 k6 k2tog fine after knitting a couple of r 5 k5 k2tog row r 7 k4 k2tog for stash busting you can knit r 9 k3 k2tog the neck flap and brim in one r 11 k2 k2tog color and the crown in a second r 13 k1 k2tog
